question.content:
Consider the following figure:



[[☃ image 1]]

**What solid 3D object is produced by rotating the rectangle about line $\blue m$?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

options.alt: A rectangle with a horizontal dashed line labeled m a distance away from the rectangle.

choices.content:
![A three dimensional figure that looks like a donut.](https://ka-perseus-images.s3.amazonaws.com/91942cedf461a6a31fb6f497b7d238d45c2cf54d.png)  
Torus

![A three dimensional figure that looks like a cylinder with a smaller cylinder removed from the center.](https://ka-perseus-images.s3.amazonaws.com/8baf3a4059ac2670678088433f9de7ad6d1a71a0.png)  
Tube

![A three dimensional figure that looks like a cone with a smaller cylinder removed from the center.](https://ka-perseus-images.s3.amazonaws.com/f0f6e33cf4a1165c732f64c118d35e39518c48b8.png)  
Hollow cone frustum

hints.content: Imagine slowly rotating the rectangle about $\blue m$. What 3D object will emerge?

Any shape rotated about a line that lies outside of it will result in a hollow 3D object.

In this case, the 3D object has cross-sections that are rectangles, and it looks like a thin, hollow cylinder. We call this shape a **tube**.



[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A three dimensional figure that looks like a cylinder with a smaller cylinder removed from the center.
